metadata.notes: First baseline export for ATA-06 dimensional data. Contains global datums, propulsion zones, and launch configuration envelope.

origin.description: Spacecraft primary datum origin at launch vehicle interface center
origin.physical_reference: Geometric center of adapter bolt circle

x.description: Longitudinal axis aligned with spacecraft centerline, positive forward

y.description: Lateral axis, positive to starboard when looking forward

z.description: Vertical axis, positive downward (toward Earth in nominal attitude)

datums.name: Spacecraft Primary Datum Origin
datums.description: The primary datum origin for the entire spacecraft. All dimensional measurements reference this origin. Defined at the geometric center of the launch vehicle adapter interface.
datums.cad_reference: Main Assembly → Datum Features → Primary Origin

datums.name: Spacecraft X-Axis Reference Line
datums.description: Primary X-axis defining the forward direction of the spacecraft. Aligned with the longitudinal axis through the center of mass and launch vehicle interface.

datums.name: Fuselage Station 0 (FS0)
datums.description: Fuselage Station 0 defines the forward-most reference plane for fuselage measurements. Perpendicular to X-axis.

zones.name: Main Propulsion Module Zone
zones.description: Primary integration zone for the main propulsion module, including engines, tanks, and feed systems.
zones.purpose: Integration envelope, thermal analysis, mass properties

zones.name: Launch Vehicle Interface Zone
zones.description: Integration zone at the launch vehicle adapter interface. Defines the region where spacecraft interfaces with launch vehicle.

bounds.description: Annular zone from X=-200 to X=0, radial from 800mm to 1500mm

zones.purpose: Launch vehicle mechanical interface, bolt pattern region

envelopes.name: Launch Configuration Envelope
envelopes.description: Maximum allowable envelope for the spacecraft in launch configuration (stowed). Must fit within launch vehicle fairing.

bounds.description: Cylindrical section (diameter 4800mm, length 6000mm) with 30° truncated cone forward section (height 1500mm)

envelopes.purpose: Maximum allowable spacecraft dimensions for launch configuration

envelopes.name: Propulsion Module Envelope
envelopes.description: Maximum envelope allocated to propulsion module. No propulsion hardware may extend beyond this envelope.

envelopes.name: Primary Structure Keep-Out Envelope
envelopes.description: Keep-out envelope defining the space occupied by primary structure. No other subsystems may intrude into this envelope without structural coordination.

bounds.description: Complex 3D surface following primary load paths and structural members

envelopes.purpose: Primary structure protection, load path preservation
